alert.note: Alert for DeKalb (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 5:08PM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern DeKalb County through 600 PM CDT... At 508 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Crossville, or 14 miles south of Rainsville, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Fort Payne, Rainsville, Crossville, Fyffe, Geraldine, Pine Ridge, Lakeview, Dog Town, Guest, and Collbran. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
